intro: Bidens hyperborea var. gaspensis, commonly known as the Gaspé ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture, while its flowers consist of yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale green to white ray florets. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
